SARS-CoV-2 variants

Open-source tracking for emerging SARS-CoV-2 variants that pose a risk based on COVID-19 vaccine genetics.

Data source

Reference genome sequence

The refernece data was sourced from:

  • GenBank: MN908947
  • Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 isolate Wuhan-Hu-1, complete genome.
  • NCBI Reference Sequence: MN908947.3
  • via https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/MN908947

A copy of this can be found in file:

  • reference_sequence_MN908947.3.md

The coding sequence was then modified to match the description of Ad26.COV2-S https://www.nature.com/articles/s41541-020-00243-x

  • Ad26.S.PP :
  • The furin cleavage site was abolished.
  • Stabiliazation by proline substitutions.
  • The correct HGVS standard notation should be: p.[Arg682Ser;p.Arg685Gln] and p.(Lys986_Val987delinsProPro).

Original reference sequence

The typical fasta linebreaks have been removed to facilitate variant position tracking.

Modified sequence of Ad26.COV2-S p.[Arg682Ser;p.Arg685Gln] and p.(Lys986_Val987delinsProPro).
